edu.um.cps2004.task1.engine

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.um.cps2004.task1.engine.GameBoard

  • public final class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    The actual Tic-Tac-Toe Gameboard. This class represents the current game state. Moreover it does so by keeping a one dimensional array as follows (kiss, principle - Keep It Stupid Simple). The board is a 3x3 matrix with positions defined as 
       0 | 1 | 2
  -----------
   3 | 4 | 5 
  -----------
   6 | 7 | 8
    Each position is initially empty and may be filled with an X or O. We now keep the number of moves played - as a cache for easier calculation of isFull, isEmpty methods.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    JP

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameBoard()
      Constructor which initialises the empty positions list to all positions on the board

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard()
        Constructor which initialises the empty positions list to all positions on the board

    • Method Detail

      • getBoardState

        public Mark[] getBoardState()
        Gets the board state (the array containing Xs and 0s). Note that this method actually returns a copy of the actual array so none of the players have a live reference to the actual board array (which they can change, hack and cheat with). Hence this method is a bit heavy and should be called sparingly.
        Returns:
        The single dimensional array representing the board state. Never null.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Checks if the board is full.
        Returns:
        true if the board is full, false otherwise

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the board is empty, simply by checking the number of moves played on this board.
        Returns:
        true if the board is full, false otherwise

      • getBoardSize

        public int getBoardSize()
        Gets the board size (this may actually be determined by calling length on the board array, but for convenience we offer this method).
        Returns:
        An int representing the board size (the one dimensional array). Positive, and always greater than 0.

      • isOccupied

        public boolean isOccupied(int position)
                   throws PositionOutOfRangeException
        Checks if a position is available. Note that this method will throw an exception if the position is out of range. That is < 0 and >= BOARD_SIZE (currently at 9).
        Parameters:
        position - The position to check for vacancy
        Returns:
        true if occupied, false otherwise
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfRangeException

      • validatePlayTentative

        public void validatePlayTentative(int tentativePosition)
                           throws PositionOutOfRangeException,
                                  PositionAlreadyOccupiedException
        This available method check for the validity of a move. Particularly it checks if the tentative position is in a valid range 0..(BOARD_SIZE-1). Also it checks if there already is a mark in the tentative position. This method should be called by all players prior to returning their playing position. The engine will disqualify any robot which does not comply to this validation.
        Parameters:
        tentativePosition - the tentative position where to play
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfRangeException - If the tentative exception is out of range < 0 and >= BOARD_SIZE (9)
        PositionAlreadyOccupiedException - If the tentative position is already occupied.

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the game board, with some funky characters. Writes to console (using System.out).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Proper toString() method which is mostly used for display purposes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • isWinningPosition

        public boolean isWinningPosition()
        Checks if this board is in a winning position. There are 8 winning positions in Tic Tac Toe wars. 
           A |   |         | A |         |   | A      A |   |   
  -----------   -----------   -----------    -----------
   A |   |         | A |         |   | A        | A |   
  -----------   -----------   -----------    -----------
   A |   |         | A |         |   | A        |   | A

  
   A | A | A       |   |         |   |          |   | A 
  -----------   -----------   -----------    -----------
     |   |       A | A | A       |   |          | A |   
  -----------   -----------   -----------    -----------
     |   |         |   |       A | A | A      A |   |
        TODO should be dynamically sized according to BOARD_SIZE.
        Returns:
        true if the board is in a winning position - false otherwise

      • getEmptyPositions

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getEmptyPositions()
        Gets an integer list of all empty positions on the board. When board is full this should return a list of size 0. Notice that we give a copy of the original emptyPositions so no one will have a live reference to it. This method is much more performant than iterating through the collection and adding to a new arraylist
        Returns:
        The list of empty positions on the board.
